Package items

Class Item

java.lang.Object
items.Item
Direct Known Subclasses:
TradeGood, Upgrade
public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
The superclass of all item types. An item is an object stored in a ship's cargo, or a shop's inventory. It can be either an upgrade (cannons...), or a tradable item
Author:
Andrew

  • Constructor Details

    • Item

      public Item​(java.lang.String name, int baseValue)
      The basic constructor of an item. Likely the version used in shops.
      Parameters:
      name - The item's name (Food, wool...)
      baseValue - The item's base value

    • Item

      public Item​(java.lang.String name, int baseValue, int purchasedPrice, java.lang.String purchasedFrom)
      A more detailed constructor, used for purchased items. Gives info on how much it cost, and where it was purchased.
      Parameters:
      name - The item's name (Food, wool...)
      baseValue - The item's base value
      purchasedPrice - How much it was bought for
      purchasedFrom - The name of the island it was bought from

    • copy

      public abstract <T extends Item> T copy()
      Creates a new copy of this item. Useful when moving items from the list of all items, to cargo etc.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Required because subclasses are annoying
      Returns:
      A new copy of this class

    • makeBought

      public <T extends Item> T makeBought​(int purchasedPrice, java.lang.String purchasedFrom)
      Fills out an existing item's `purchased...` fields
      Type Parameters:
      T - Required because subclasses are annoying
      Parameters:
      purchasedPrice - How much it was bought for
      purchasedFrom - The name of the island it was bought from
      Returns:
      this (For chaining)
